Pricing pages must transparently display usage metrics and costs to build trust for consumption-based models.
Do: Include clear cost-per-unit metrics and spending caps; link to usage dashboards.
Don't: Hidden fees or ambiguous "contact sales" for basic usage.

Description: Interactive tools allowing users to estimate costs based on their specific usage scenarios.
Do: Use sliders/inputs for key metrics (users, storage, API calls) to auto-calculate estimated monthly cost.
Don't: Static pricing tables for complex usage models.

Description: Allow users to easily switch between monthly and annual billing views to see savings.
Do: Use a toggle switch with clear 'Save 20%' badges for annual plans.
Don't: Separate pages for monthly vs annual pricing.

Description: Detailed breakdown of features across plans, often using collapsible sections or tooltips to avoid clutter.
Do: Use sticky headers for plan names; collapsable categories for long lists.

Description: Organize footer links into clear, responsive grid columns for readability and navigation efficiency.
Do: Use CSS Grid with 4-5 columns for desktop, collapsing to 1-2 for mobile.
Don't: Unstructured lists or center-aligned chaotic links.

Description: Curated lists of important but secondary links (e.g., 'Popular Resources', 'User Personas') to guide users who reached the bottom.
Do: Group links by user intent or popularity; include a 'Back to Top' button.
Don't: Repeating the entire header navigation or dumping all site map links.

Description: A final call-to-action area just above or within the footer to capture users who have scrolled through the entire page.
Do: Place a prominent 'Start Free Trial' or 'Contact Us' section before the legal footer.
Don't: Burying the CTA in fine print or omitting it entirely at the bottom.

Description: Clearly separated section for copyright, privacy policy, terms of service, and accessibility statements.
Do: Visually distinct (smaller text/lower contrast) row at the very bottom; ensure accessibility links are present.
Don't: Mixing legal links with navigation links randomly.
